mtg.style: Short sentences, patient, do not argue. Answer 'why/how' using approved points.

talk: Jordan, thanks for joining. I’m going to be direct. Your employment is ending effective today due to attendance not meeting policy expectations, as documented in prior discussions.

Here are the documented facts we’re basing this on: in the last 60 days there were three no-call/no-show shifts (Dec 18, Jan 9, Jan 28) and nine late arrivals greater than 15 minutes. Attendance expectations and the impact on the team were reviewed with you.

We took progressive steps before today: coaching on Dec 19, a written warning on Jan 10, and a final warning on Jan 29 with clear expectations going forward. After the final warning, there was another missed shift on Feb 2.
If you want to share your perspective, I can listen and document it, but the employment decision itself will not change in this meeting.
I’ll walk through next steps now: final pay timing, any benefits information if applicable, and how to collect personal items.

log.pay: Final pay will be handled through standard payroll; details will be provided in writing.
log.ben: If any benefits apply, information and deadlines will be provided in writing; HR can answer questions.
log.prop: Return any company items per instructions you’ll receive today (if applicable).
log.access: If you have any system/app access, it will be disabled shortly after this meeting.
log.verify: Employment verification is handled through the standard HR process; details will be provided.
log.bel: Personal items onsite will be coordinated for pickup via the manager.

hr.name: HR Operations
hr.appeal: If a review process applies, follow the steps in the written notice.

inst: If asked ‘why wasn’t I given another chance’: restate the documented progression and final warning.
If asked to debate the accuracy of dates: acknowledge and route dispute documentation to case.hr.chan; do not litigate on the call.
